timeline.bodyText: I think your xml indentation settings might be out of date (or perhaps it's the previous edit on this file that went wrong). See https://github.com/eclipse/rdf4j/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#xml-indentation . There's a maven command to fix it for you - though it might be a good idea to adjust your editor settings as well.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText:
As a temporary fix this is fine, but perhaps it should be optional instead (see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40393098/when-to-use-optionaltrue-optional-and-when-to-use-scopeprovided-scope) - the difference is mostly semantic, but optional is more intended to say "it's up to you as a user to decide if you need/want this thing", whereas provided scope is more for things that are just expected to be present in the runtime environment (e.g. for a webapp, you could have the servlet-api jar as provided).
Also: I haven't looked at the code, but can the extensible store still operate if this library is not available? Or will it just crash with a ClassNotFoundException? Don't bother if this is a massive effort but if we can do a simple check and have a fallback that (no matter how ineffecient) at least works, it makes the "optional" story a bit more convincing :)
